embeds.title: Serve & Protect
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 10 (15) **Block** :p_block: and 1 **Blur** :p_blur: for each Slime.
**Absorb** all Slimes.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: ah yes, the 45 block 3 blur 3 strengh 1 energy card
This card has become absolutely massive with the patch
<devide and conquer> is still kinda mid though (I just hate random targeting cards)

embeds.title: Divide & Conquer
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 10 (15) damage to a random enemy for each Slime.
**Absorb** all Slimes.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: block and damage should not be valued the same if they have the same numbers, and this also has blur. Plus slime doesn't have shit when it comes to block, so this is a lot better than divide and conquer
its one of the few multihits on Slime Boss, so it scales well with goop. Id reccoment using it as a big goop finisher

anyways, I havent played slime boss much, so im not sure how this card works in the most recent patch. Id assume its pretty damn good, basically a conditional <dissolve> but way better, and it wont fuck you in long fights if you use it early because you can get slimes back easier thanks to new Split.

embeds.title: Dissolve
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 2 :e_hermit: / The Hermit / Downfall

Gain 12 (18) **Block** :p_block:.
**Block** :p_block: is not removed at the start of your next 2 turns.
**Exhaust**.

messages.content: Also every time we talk about blur i realize how mediocre Dissolve and <hold Firm> are

embeds.title: Hold Firm
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / 2 :e_champ: / The Champ / Downfall

Gain 10 (13) **Block** :p_block:.
Gain 10 (13) **Counter** :p_counter:.
Gain 1 **Blur** :p_blur:.

messages.content: At least Dissolve has good block values, Hold Firm is a worse, rare <Dash> with a blur stapled to it

embeds.title: Dash
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :e_green: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Gain 10 (13) **Block** :p_block:.
Deal 10 (13) damage.

messages.content: 5 block upgrade on a 1 cost uncommon card is pretty massive especially since you benefit from it multiple times
i honestly think this could get a numbers nerf
like, just getting 1 slime is 15 block and a blur for 1 cost
thats huge
AND you gain strength

To get it out of the way quickly, yes the number on this are kind of silly. 10 (15) per slime is a huge amount of block for 1 energy, and even just 2-3 stacks of blur is enough to last the duration of several fights. Even at just 1 slime, the numbers are still very favorable compared to blur (silent card), dissolve, and hold firm. You also inherently gain 1 strength for every slime absorbed.

In theory this is probably supposed to be balanced by there being times where you have 0 slimes (and it exhausting), but that just isn't going to happen very often. This will also usually provide enough block and blur that it exhausting is not much of a concern. Strange spoon (if you can find it) is also just generally excellent on slime boss with the split cards, equalize, prepare, replication, slime tap, leech life, shape of puddle, and sometimes licks.

Serve and Protect is at it's best when you can reliably supply slimes for it, so it has strong synergies with goop dweller, jeremiah's banner, glop chop, and upgraded split (the starter card). Runic pyramid can help hold it until the right moment to stack the block, as well as letting you wait until you have as many slimes as possible to absorb. 

The upgrade is very good, even for a 1 shot effect, especially when you can provide multiple slimes reliably. You can probably get away with taking this blindly even in act 1, there are enough split cards available in your card pool that you are extremely likely to find something to help out split. It also performs pretty well against most hallway fights, lagavulin, and tri sentries. 

It's hard to really suggest a change, it probably should be nerfed to at least 8 (11), or you could alter is so that it just provides a flat 1 blur, rather than scaling with each slime absorbed. It's too much mitigation for 1 energy, and the drawback doesn't come up very often
Serve in protect goes in tandem with <leeching strike> and with that much block you can kinda coast whatever fight your in

embeds.title: Leeching Strike
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 5 (8) damage.
**Consume** - Gain **Block** :p_block: equal to the enemy's **Goop** :p_goop:.

messages.content: broken its acutally broken. At its absolute worst when its just being used with 1 slime in play; 10 block and 1 blur is still worth it. Its hard for me to decide if this or divide and conquer is better.  I'm tempted to say its divide because it often reads "win this fight this turn" it does need to ramp up firs though which although is not hard it may not be doable on turn 1/2 (leaving it to be a dead draw sometimes). where as serve and protect is worth using even with just a single slime and is overall the more consistant card even if its overall power isnt as strong (of course 45 block and 3 blur is still absolutely insane)

I would say serve is better as it's generally just overall more usuable I like devide and conquer as a finisher as well but you can also just retain a bunch of block from leeching strike to win aswell
Cause with 3 turns of retained block you should be able to kill
Yeah and slime boss really doesn't have the best block in the first place, so that 45 is quite a lot
especially with the basically lack of a downside
The only downside of this card is drawing it early
That's not a big enough downside to offset the fact that you are basically playing an impervious++ with 3 blurs
all for 1 energy
That's fair I suppose it would probably be best to massively reduce the block gain from this card
If have any at all
The blur is enough to supplement most slime decks because one of the biggest problems it has is blocking
Blur only helps if you have excess block.
I would take this card if it was blur per slime alone is what I'm saying
<leeching strike> is a common card

embeds.title: Leeching Strike
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Deal 5 (8) damage.
**Consume** - Gain **Block** :p_block: equal to the enemy's **Goop** :p_goop:.

messages.content: I would never, you'd rarely actually have enough block for it to matter.
That card itself can easily blick for 30
In one turn
Alright so it works in situations where you stack a ton of goop on an enemy, then draw 2 specific cards together.
<goop armor> is also very good

embeds.title: Goop Armor
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Gain 3 (4) **Block** :p_block: whenever you **Consume.**

messages.content: It would be very bad with 0 block.
Atleast in how I draft
It still gives 3 turns of blur so any block you gain would be retained
And casting it for one slime would no longer be worth it
Anyway I'd rather see the blur go than the block.

A card that gives conditional blur and that is it is just weird, the only card that gives just blur is blockchain, and that only works because it is paired with block on functions, and you often overblock on auto due to functions
The main issue I have with it just giving block is that slimeboss already has big blocking problems one turn you can block for 60 then draw no block next turn
I don't think removing the block from the card would make it more balanced, it would just kill the card.
This card in general solves that issue with the blur it gives
Atleast with big block generators/turns like <Teamwork> and leeching slime

embeds.title: Teamwork
embeds.description:
Rare Skill / X :e_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

**Command** X times.
Gain 5 (8) **Block** :p_block: X times.

messages.content: Hell you could just make the upgrade of that card give an extra blur by base then it would be extremely good
If serve and protect was just block I would likely just pass it for devide and conquer
Now if you just made it 5(8) block 1 blur it'd be much more balanced in general
Per slime of course
I dont think slime boss has any issues at all blocking past act one (and thats really only because of your much lower max HP)
healing can substitute for block pretty well and slime boss has its own reaper and a very strong starter relic
Aren't there only 4 common block cards
Yeah heart of goo is very solid
You also have leech slimes, improved frost orbs
Leech slimes are ok without potency at best
They are one of the best slimes though
As they're the only one that blocks

messages.content: Forgot about living wall

Its not uncommon for my runs to end up taking some potency and relying pretty much only on leech slimes giving me like 30 block a turn (then just using healing to offset all chip damage from tackles and setting up)
those 5 common block cards are also all strong
I tend to combo roll through into my deck for act 1 as it's a solid card
Especially for not taking that chip damage from tackles
Reformation and living wall are really good
Same with the lick
leeching slime giving 6 block when played makes it count as a block card in my eyes so thats 6 good common blocks; much more then most characters like defect, hermit, snecko and silent
I don't like slime spikes but that's just me

its the weakest once out of the 6 but its still pretty good. Completely trolls birds and book of stabbing while being good ageist group fights in general. Really the only problem it has is that you don't have an easy way to keep the thorns like guardian does.
Also merchant too
